caption.center: RUPERT POLLARD, Appellant v. FALLCO, INC. AND JAMES EDWARD FALLMAN AND

court.center: Court of Appeals of Texas, Second District, Fort Worth.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the 67th District Court of Tarrant County.
opinion.attorneys:
Rupert Pollard, pro se.
Gregory R. Ave, Touchstone, Bernays, Johnston, Beall, Smith Stollenwerk, L.L.P., Dallas, TX, for appellee (Fallco, Inc. and James Edward Fallman).
Scott William Self and Bryan Powell Reese, Fee, Smith, Sharp Vitullo, Dallas, TX, for appellee (Layana Collette Maxie).
opinion.panel: Panel D: HOLMAN, GARDNER, and WALKER, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
On July 30, 2004 we notified appellant that his brief had not been filed as required by rule 38.6(a). See TEX. R. APP. P. 38.6(a). We stated we would dismiss the appeal for want of prosecution unless appellant or any party desiring to continue this appeal filed with the court within ten days a response showing grounds for continuing the appeal. We have not received any response.
Because appellant's brief has not been filed, we dismiss the appeal for want of prosecution. See TEX. R. APP. P. 38.8(a)(1), 42.3(b).
